question.text: Select the incorrect statement from the following about the anatomy of angiosperms.

options.text: The cells of medullary rays, adjoining the intrafascicular cambium becomes meristematic and forms interfascicular cambium.
In isobilateral leaf, the mesophyll is undifferentiated into palisade and spongy parenchyma.
Vascular bundles in a dicot stem are arranged in a scattered manner.
Bulliform cells are observed in the leaves of some monocots.

solution.text: Vascular bundles in dicot stem are conjoint, collateral and open, they are arranged in ring around the central pith. Scattered vascular bundles are present in monocot stem in which ground tissue is undifferentiated.
